src.analysis.common package¶

Submodules¶

src.analysis.common.model_utils module¶

Helpers for normalizing model/domain tokens in directory names.

src.analysis.common.model_utils.detect_domain(name_lower: str) → str | None[source]¶

Normalize a lowered directory name to Math/Crossword/Carpark.

src.analysis.common.model_utils.detect_model_key(name_lower: str) → str | None[source]¶

Return the canonical model key (llama8b/qwen7b) if obvious from the name.

src.analysis.common.model_utils.detect_temperature(name_lower: str, low_alias: float) → float | None[source]¶

Extract temperature tokens, respecting low aliases.

src.analysis.common.mpl_stub_helpers module¶

Shared matplotlib stub helpers to keep pylint duplication checks happy.

class src.analysis.common.mpl_stub_helpers.AxisSettersMixin[source]¶

Bases: object

Mixin providing no-op axis setter methods for stubbed matplotlib.

axhline(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op axhline used in stub axes.

fill_between(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op fill_between used in stub axes.

get_legend_handles_labels()[source]¶

Return empty legend handles/labels for stub axes.

grid(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op grid call used in stub axes.

legend(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op legend call used in stub axes.

plot(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op plot used in stub axes.

set_title(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op title setter used in stub axes.

set_xlabel(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op xlabel setter used in stub axes.

set_xticklabels(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op xticklabels setter used in stub axes.

set_xticks(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op xticks setter used in stub axes.

set_ylabel(*_args: Any, **_kwargs: Any)[source]¶

No-op ylabel setter used in stub axes.

src.analysis.common.mpl_stub_helpers.coerce_axes_sequence(axes: Any, expected: int | None = None) → list[Any][source]¶

Normalize matplotlib axes containers into a list for downstream iteration.

Matplotlib may return a NumPy array of axes while stubs may return a single axis; this helper always returns a list and optionally repeats a single axis to match an expected length.

src.analysis.common.mpl_stub_helpers.ensure_switch_backend(plt_mod: Any) → Any[source]¶

Add a no-op switch_backend to a stubbed pyplot if missing.

src.analysis.common.parser_helpers module¶

Common argparse helpers shared across multiple analysis CLIs.

src.analysis.common.parser_helpers.add_binning_argument(parser: ArgumentParser, *, default: str = 'uniform') → None[source]¶

Add the shared --binning option used by entropy/uncertainty plots.

src.analysis.common.parser_helpers.add_carpark_softscore_args(parser: ArgumentParser, *, op_default: str = 'ge', threshold_default: float = 0.1) → None[source]¶

Add shared Carpark soft-score threshold arguments used by multiple plots.

src.analysis.common.parser_helpers.add_entropy_range_args(parser: ArgumentParser) → None[source]¶

Add entropy/uncertainty binning arguments shared by multiple scripts.

src.analysis.common.parser_helpers.standard_results_parser(dataset_default: str = 'MATH-500', model_default: str = 'Qwen2.5-1.5B') → ArgumentParser[source]¶

Return a parser preconfigured with the typical results-root arguments.

src.analysis.common.pass_extraction module¶

Shared helpers for extracting text/answers from pass dictionaries.

src.analysis.common.pass_extraction.extract_pass_answer(pass_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → str | None[source]¶

Attempt to extract a concise answer string from a pass dictionary.

src.analysis.common.pass_extraction.extract_pass_text(pass_dict: Dict[str, Any]) → str | None[source]¶

Return the most relevant assistant text from a pass dictionary.

src.analysis.common.problem_utils module¶

Shared helpers for deriving stable problem identifiers across analysis scripts.

src.analysis.common.problem_utils.resolve_problem_identifier(record: Dict[str, Any], fallback: str | None = None) → str[source]¶

Return the best-effort textual identifier for a problem row.

Preference order:

  1. Explicit problem/question/clue/row_key fields

  2. dataset_index (formatted as idx:<n>)

  3. Provided fallback string

  4. Literal "unknown"

src.analysis.common.uncertainty module¶

Shared helpers for standardizing uncertainty columns across analysis scripts.

src.analysis.common.uncertainty.standardize_uncertainty(data: DataFrame, source_col: str = 'uncertainty', dest_col: str = 'uncertainty_std') → DataFrame[source]¶

Return a copy of data with a standardized uncertainty column added.

src.analysis.common.uncertainty.standardize_uncertainty_with_stats(data: DataFrame, source_col: str = 'uncertainty', dest_col: str = 'uncertainty_std') → Tuple[DataFrame, float, float][source]¶

Standardize the uncertainty column and also return the (mean, std) statistics.

Module contents¶

Common helper modules shared across analysis scripts.
